Key Match Events: The Knicks scored four straight points to get within six, then won a challenge to overturn a foul that was called on Josh Hart and get the ball back. But they didn't score, and Caldwell-Pope and Carter made 3s in a 7-2 spurt that pushed it to 95-84 with 3:05 remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks were held to their lowest point total of the season in their season-high third straight loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando avoided a four-game sweep by winning the final meeting, keeping the lead in the all-time series at 68-66.
Others: The game was played on January 7, 2025, and the Knicks were missing Karl-Anthony Towns due to right knee pain.
